newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Lufthansa adds flights to ex-Soviet Union.
newsitem.headline: Lufthansa adds flights to ex-Soviet Union.

text.p: Deutsche Lufthansa AG will add flights on its regular routes to Russia and ex-Soviet destinations in its summer schedule, the company's Moscow office said on Tuesday.
Lufthansa will add two flights a week from Frankfurt to the central Russian cities of Samara and Nizny Novgorod, as well as on the Frankfurt-Yekaterinburg-Novosibirsk route, it said.
It also said that it would add a third weekly flight from Frankfurt to Baku, the Azerbaijani capital, and Ashgabat, Turkmenistan's capital.
Additional flights will run from Hamburg and Berlin to St Petersburg, it added.
Lufthansa began regular flights from Franfurt to Perm in Russia's Ural Mountain region, via Kazan, the capital of Tatarstan, on March 31, operating Airbus Industrie A-319 jets.
The statement said that the company services 15 destinations in the former Soviet Union.
